definition: (classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

pinyin: Zhi2 ye4 Gao1 er3 fu1 qiu2 Xie2 hui4

sentences.chinese: 他在18洞的高爾夫賽程中得了85杆的成績。

sentences.english: Third, we should pull with golf-related industries.
sentences.chinese: 三是要堅持拉動與高爾夫相關產業的發展。
他是出色的高爾夫球手。

sentences.english: There is only one practicing spot here in Liuyang. I have been there for only three times.
sentences.chinese: 在瀏陽只有一個高爾夫場地，我去過三次。

sentences.english: Or the one where Elaine bids on JFK’s golf clubs?
sentences.chinese: 或是伊琳競投肯尼迪高爾夫俱樂部？

sentences.english: A golf course is nothing but a poolroom moved outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 不，高爾夫球場不過是一個會動的戶外臺。

sentences.english: They can be as tiny as a grain of sand or as large as a golf ball.
sentences.chinese: 大小可細如沙粒也可大似高爾夫球。

sentences.english: The uniform of green speed on the Willow golf course was worse in Spring.
sentences.chinese: 高爾夫球場果嶺球速春季比夏季和秋季較慢。

sentences.english: Fast-swing players make up the majority of the avid golf population.
sentences.chinese: 揮杆速度偏快的球友已形成爲數衆多的高爾夫人口。

sentences.english: Laze on the white-sand beach or golf on two world-ranked courses.
sentences.chinese: 在白沙灘或高爾夫球拉則在兩個世界排名課程。

sentences.english: Even geekier than Bill of Rights Golf.
sentences.chinese: 比高爾夫權利法案更瘋狂。

sentences.english: There is golf-ball-size hail in New Jersey today.
sentences.chinese: 新澤西州今日下起高爾夫球大小的冰雹。

sentences.english: I have nothing against playing golf.
sentences.chinese: 我對打高爾夫沒什麼意見。

sentences.english: Let'sgo to the golf course this afternoon and tee off at 2o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天下午兩點去高爾夫球場打球吧。

sentences.english: I could go and play some golf.
sentences.chinese: 我能去打一些高爾夫球。

sentences.english: "People can play golf anywhere, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “人們在哪都能玩高爾夫球，”他說。

definition: club (the organisation or its premises) (loanword)/CL:個|个[ge4]
invitation tournament (e.g. between schools or firms)
